8y5ewnokHaFkUZ-zION8kQ.text: The latest of the Draft House venues, and while I haven't been to either of the other two, I'm guessing the formula is the same.A great focus on beer with over 20 taps of local and international beers. The bottle range is also extensive with German and Belgian brews, as well as a solid range of US micros. I was happy to find the local Kernel beers in the fridge too. It is on the pricey side for beers but compared with other beer bars around the city it's all relative.I didn't try the food so can't comment on that but it does seem popular with the after work diners.To sum up it's worth a look if you're with friends and wanting something different beer wise than the many run of the mill pubs in the area.

I4EAMwHpkyeObEzMNDTy6A.text: for full review and pictures please visit my bloghungryinlondon.com/2010/…  I was so excited to learn that a new, decently priced gastro pub had opened South of Tower Bridge, about 10 min from where I live. And I was even more pleased when I read the review by Jay Rayner who really liked the food there. Now I finally made it to The Draft House and I have to disagree with good old Jay as I found the whole experience rather disappointing. The Draft House is part of a tiny chain (with 2 more pubs, one in Battersea and the other in Clapham) and, as the name promises, it specializes on beer. My beer drinking years are long gone, not because I don't like beer but because merely looking at it gives me the worst hangover. Maybe that's why the Draft House and I were off to a bad start? The menu is definitely appealing and there were a lot of things that I wanted to order. We settled for one of the 'Pots': Smoked Mackerel with Chutney & Sourdough (4.75). The mackerel pate was rather nice and so was the chutney. However, mackerel and chutney together were plainly wrong. My taste buds always expected meat pate and then there was fish. So they were confused and not convinced. Would have been much nicer with just some lemon or horseradish sauce. The bread was good though. As a second starter something healthy: the Honey Roast Parsnip, Broccoli, Cherry Tomatoes, Watercress & Pine Nuts (6.25) was clearly not the most spectacular of all dishes but very decent for a salad with a sweet balsamic honey dressing and lovely parsnips. It went downwards with the mains. The waiter told us that their restaurant is 'getting famous for their burgers'. After I sampled their Burger (+smoked cheddar) (9.90) I would doubt this statement. It was well-priced and a generous portion, no doubt about this, but tastewise it did not convince as the bun was dry and so was the meat. If you are in the area and looking for a nice burger, I recommend the King's Arms just around the corner. Up until this moment the food was, even though without major highlight, relatively decent. The Fish of the Day, Celeriac, Curly Kale (12.75) however was a disaster. The cod was overcooked, the curly kale extremely salty and everything was swimming in oil. To be fair, it said it came with Sauce Vierge which is an olive oil based sauce but nevertheless I am sure that this is not supposed to taste like this? I really wanted to like the Draft House. This modern gastro-pub has a rather pleasant atmosphere, the staff was lovely and I really could have seen myself hanging out there a lot. However, I don't think I need to repeat this culinary experience

8r4K233j9cc-LzLG_SQPPw.text: The draft house is an American diner meets london gastro pub. Great beer, quality wine list, and amazing clam chowder! Big thumbs up. Just make sure you get there early or book in advance to avoid disappointment...

ReuSnsxybBBx_XKHzJj6ig.text: cute place to grab a few beers, open spacious around the bar area... :)

CgZLqK3KfbXiui-zJT9Z_A.text: What a difference a year has made to the Draft House. We turned up on the Monday before Christmas at 7pm for dinner to find the place pretty much deserted and very low on atmosphere. No worries on that account as we were 10 strong and had brought plenty of the festive spirit with us. We had the same table in the back room where we had sat a year previously and, other than the strange lack of folk, things seemed to be set fair for an evening of good food and drink. Unfortunately this was not to be the case as the food offering at the Draft House has gone rapidly downhill over the course of the last year. This may account for the lack of punters at what should be the busiest, buzziest time of the year. Starters where bland at best and pretty dreadful at worst; with special mention of the soup in the latter category. Moving onto the mains saw no improvement; my beef had certainly been slow cooked but was dry and tough while the salmon had been very badly overdone. It was a relief to get to the dessert course with the end now in sight but there was still no respite from the dreadful food; my creme brûlée had a nasty eggy flavour and a strange consistency while the cheese election was just plain disappointing. On the upside the staff were very nice and friendly and the beer selection from the cask, keg and bottle was pretty decent. All things considered this was a big let down when compared to our experience at the Draft House the previous year and the overwhelming consensus amongst my companions was that its time had well and truly been and gone. Looks like the nearby Dean Swift could be getting our business next year .. Went here a couple of weeks before Christmas with a bunch of the guys for dinner and a few choice beers. Despite my reservations about venturing out for food in these types of settings at this time of year I was more than pleasantly surprised. Yes it was absolutely packed and yes the service was a little slow but other than these minor gripes it was good news all round and I will definitely be giving the Draft House a return visit in the New Year to sample the fine beer selection once again. We sat in the back area of the bar which was marginally quieter than the front area but was still pretty lively; a good spot if you are with a large crowd. We had reserved our table a few weeks beforehand to ensure we could be accommodated and we had been warned that it would be very busy and that turning up on time was essential if we wanted to get fed at a reasonable hour. For once we all managed to comply. Food wise I was very pleased with my selection from the Christmas set menu. My starter of Arbroath salmon ballotine was a big slab of very tasty, moist, well flavoured fish. The main of goose with all the trimmings was well cooked and presented, with a selection of meat from across the bird. The vegetables still had a little bit of bite and a good flavour which was a minor miracle given the number of covers they were serving on this evening. This was all washed down with a couple of pints of the Wandle ale and a Porterhouse Red. I finished off with a plate of three artisan cheeses and some chutney accompanied by a bottle of the Yeti Imperial Stout, an inspired marriage if I say so myself. Despite having a focus on the beer, well it is called the Draft House, there was a decent choice of wine and our sparkling expert, Ms Pattison, was very enthusiastic about the Prosecco. Even on a busy night the staff were all very friendly, helpful and only to happy to make recommendations on what would work well with your food choice. The 3 course set menu was £22.50 which I thought was pretty good value considering the venue, the time of year and the quality of the food; our very varied party, who can be quick to complain, all declared themselves well pleased with their dinner and a return visit is already on the cards.

isbRw8EmoPyVGfLohGYzmw.text: limited menu. long waiting time.most bland english breakfast ever ! shant return !!

8YFOHyFGr_vXSFfpgv58Nw.text: After visiting Tower Bridge I was wandering and hunting for a place to eat. When you don't know which restaurants to try and don't have access to reviews pick a place that has happy looking people inside and plenty of people. I had a quick burger for lunch, a half pint and went on about my way. It was tasty and the staff was great.

zLrtXBCrDcilBYI2vDQ4og.text: Great location, great selection of beers, and great for groups!  The interior is farmhouse chic.  I didn't have any food but I was there with a large group and we were all able to crowd around an area with a large table and plenty of seating without crowding anyone else out.  An even larger group showed up a bit later and claimed the island in the middle.  They were able to do their own thing without bothering anyone else in the place including us.My only caveat, and the reason for 4 stars, is due to the wait at the bar.  Gees!  Can a girl get a beer over here?  How about having more than two bartenders? Or, you're only pulling taps and popping bottles, how bout you manage more than one order at a time?  Especially when you're just waiting for the debit purchase to go through.  Staring at the machine doesn't mean I'm not still waiting for you to acknowledge me.  Luckily, due to the large group, I only had to go to the bar once.  But, had I been forced to go more than once I'm pretty sure, 3 months later, I'd still be waiting for my beer.

kjsHxOF9pTpDv_EHEf1QQQ.text: If I am ever lucky enough to have my own pub, and I have a designer, I will make their job very simple.  Get on a plane with me, come to London and see the Draft House.  I want my place to be like this, down to the Ghostbuster wallpaper.I think this has to be one of the most comfortable, stylish and coolest places that I have ever been in.  There is no bullshit here and the beer selection is awesome.  My buddy and I walked in, grabbed a pint and sat at their communal high table.The bartender was super nice and chatted with me about american beers of which they stock a bunch of.  They carry only the really good ones so definitely give it a shot if that's what you're looking for.  They also carry a standard healthy selection of cask ales to please the Londoners.If I lived here, I would come here every week.

8QHij6ffpmluXLxYqdpm-g.text: I like this place a lot.The atmosphere was fun, the bar was well stocked and delightfully varied.I expected it to be completely rammed after the jubilee celebration, given its location, but it was just about right.I will be back.

2_kNOPD4YQQH484262P24Q.text: Really liked the atmosphere and wait staff here. It was an open place and felt welcoming. I wish I'd had a pint since it is a pub but I was there for lunch. Unfortunately, none of our lunches were particularly impressive. My veggie burger wasn't flavorful (not surprising but I keep hoping), my mom's burger was dry and my nephew's schnitzel was also dry (and came with no gravy... Weird.)The best bit of the meal was the batter on my onion rings. Lovely and crisp. I bet their fish and chips is spot on.  Wish I'd gotten that!

PE80QyzOfdsvRDjy2jXSLg.text: After reading some reviews here and as I was in London photographing a wedding, I made it a point to eat and drink here our last night in town. I was not disappointed. The folks that reviewed the food are dead on, good food, great selection of beers and not too overly packed. Crowded in a good way, you know? Everything was well done, servers and staff were friendly and happy to be there. Highly recommend.

0NqNsrLaUFlPdhhRZUbGCg.text: This place did not impress me at all,to start with the music volume is too loud when eating.The Burger I had was on the small side and very dry, could hardly eat it. My wife ordered a fillet steak which was over done instead of very rare.The chips were reasonably good.The only good thing was the beer which is a bit pricey.Service was friendly but average as the place was very empty for an early Saturday evening,and oh dont forget there is a 12% service charge automatically added to your bill at the end of u'r dining experience.Food wise, this place can't compete with other well known places.

-mIPJ9yP54oXlyBeGztzWw.text: Cute pub that's very "American" themed (with their beers and some of their events). I liked a lot of their food selection and the service was great!

qHt71FGMR1xU-Ly9fyolVg.text: Food was awesome. Service was great.  Will be back there in November and I can't wait!!!!

photos.caption: Photo of The Draft House - London, United Kingdom

HftKsqs14i_ikppIhaFwdQ.text: Great bear near the Tower Bridge. Good layout, had nice bar stools near the open air entrance. Pints were around 3.50 pounds which is comparable  to NYC prices.   Good place to com with friends or even if you're sightseeing and just want to come in for a pint.  I will definitely come back when I'm in London!

gwwXKqC8o2tchWlOa9tQgg.text: The star-rating for this is an aggregate - 4stars for the general bar experience and 2 stars for the meal i have just had there - and the 2 stars are being generous since i usually reserve the 1 star rating for instances where i've found live insects in my dish.Generally i do like this place, it's a good location (near where i live) it's got a good selection of beers, and a nice vibe. This was the first time i have eaten however. Perhaps stupidly i tried to opt for something healthy, so chose the vietnamese Salad with chicken (though i could barely find any chicken in there). This was one of the worst meals i have paid for in a long, long time. As i stipulated earlier, i paid a £2 premium for chicken. The chicken was shredded. Very shredded. So much so that the largest bit of chicken i managed to find after a lot of salad excavation was the approximate size of an anorexic house fly. The sum total of the chicken amounted to possibly less than 1 chicken wing. As for the rest of the salad, it wasnt so much a salad as it was a mountain of bean sprouts, with a few lumps of cucumber and some lettuce leaves. Not having some sort of bean-sprouts fetish i wasnt particularly impressed. In the end i left over half of it since the foraging for chicken was turning out to be a negative return - burning more calories than i was ultimately ingesting.That being said, one of party said his chicken burger was good, and the rest of them seemed to be happy with their choices...so perhaps it was just a chronic case of poor-ordering.

reRni8_L-fzOHvQKgd9JFw.text: The latest of three Draft House pubs, the Tower Bridge addition has an impressive and thoughtfully chosen range of quality beer (draft, cask and bottle). On my recent visit I enjoyed a few different beers all suggested by my server or paired especially with my food. Liquid highlights included a draft pulled Meteor Seasonal (from a family-run brewery in France founded in 1640, apple toned without coming across as fruity), a bottle of well balanced Goose Island Honker Ale (an English Ale via Chicago) and the locally brewed cask ale, Sambrook's Wandle. Most beers are priced around £4 for a pint or bottle (but half and even third pint drafts are available). The food menu here is tastier and more inventive than at most pubs, though some work on presentation of dishes might be in order. Venison and hazelnut cabbage with pear was certainly delish, ample and seasonally agreeable but not the prettiest assemblage I'd ever seen on a plate. Beer battered East Coast haddock with minted peas, chips and tartar sauce looked and tasted as it should have and was particularly massive. Forgoing dessert, a chocolaty Westmalle Dubbel rounded the meal out nicely.

m44FDMqzOOu9Lp4HedYnRA.text: Really good quality food, extensive range of really interesting looking beers and welcoming and friendly. Only slight quibble is that the food is restaurant prices but with pub levels of service. I can't imagine what our £10 service charge was for as there wasn't really any service beyond polite ordering and having food placed on the table. We've visited the Draft House three times and had our entire order forgotten once, and only part of the meal delivered once. As it's delicious when it arrives, it's not the end of the world but just shouldn't happen. This is a very good pub which is very nearly an amazing pub, but not quite there yet.

8xhgbNSRxUZUhazCQ5PJZw.text: A nice pub. Large space. Big windows. Decent range of beers on cask, keg and bottle. No complaints with the staff. Can't recall if they serve food. Certainly worth checking out if you're in the area.

BgLNjUk5OzXsLEIaeBWpRw.text: So good, we came back a few days later. The food was really good. On Sunday we had their special pork roast, and we also liked their salads. They have one Asian-inspired and one Mediterranean-inspired salad that you can get with or without chicken, so it's suitable for vegans. The chicken is shredded, which I liked, but it loses points for being kind of dry. We also liked their scotch egg and their interesting beer selection.

G8W6yZRhM_vdVOtxQ06rag.text: Amazing beer bar!  If I lived in London, I would be here frequently - and will return.  Wish every pub were like this.

XIVto4ti258ZewtBxMo09g.text: From the pictures on the website, I was expecing a more traditional gastropub. The restaurant is larger than you expect, and the atmosphere wasn't quite there for me. The Draft Cider was delicious, and the Fish & Chips were perfectly crispy. The food was good, and definitely a great spot within walking distance of Tower Bridge Hotels that is actually open on Sunday, unlike most of the other restaurants in the area. I would sit in the front room next time and probably try the Sunday Roast.

x_wv1hcgvWtf27yqrWNlGw.text: Excellent pub with great beer and food. Can cater for large parties downstairs, providing food and your own selection of beers on tap! Found that one of the barstaff could have been more friendly. Not the cheapest pub in the world but neither is any alternative in the area.

PEH3SnXLfibzbhesUiAoDw.text: I didn't eat here although the menu did look interesting, so this review is just of the place as a drinking establishment. And its a nice drinking establishment, with a very wide range of beers on tap and in bottles and friendly service. The pale ale was very tasty.

8vdOdPE4Xi8dqCEuRX435A.text: Having not been back to this Draft House since a few monthsafter it's opening, the last review made me a a bit nervous about dragging theboys here for one of our monthly beer fests. Luckily I wasn't let down. The staffwere twinkly and attentive, and seemed to know their stuff when it came to thebeers, without straying into CAMRA-esque droning. 6 of us had various burgers and dogswith recommended beer matches. The highlights being the poke chilli cheese burger,which has since become a byword for measuring one's masculinity, paired with Texas Lone Star lager (bottle removed by one of the party for a fancy dress outfit), and the Kasekrainer hot dog stuffed withmelted cheese (which has also become a byword) with Steigel served in very pleasingweighty glasses. Nice staff, great pics, suitably amusing cuisine and decentbeers, will be back sooner this time.

_BTQCJXZQV6FEuBLDquQ3Q.text: Went here for a leaving party with work colleagues. Huge range of beer, and a small, but well chosen range of wines.Excellent range of beers on tap, which change on a regular basis. Large range of craft ales from around the world in the fridges in the back; Hitachino from Japan, and some more obscure ones from Scandinavia.Staff are attentive,and are keen to warn you when you're about to make a purchase of a   (1) very strong(2) very expensive (3) all of the above beer.A few of us stayed quite late (read, they were sweeping up around us) - and the staff were very good about us being late.Food is good, service is swift.

photos.caption: Photo of The Draft House - London, United Kingdom. A beer of Liquid Confidence...

GWDo8rmxCIkYvuikNgo08A.text: - one of the best craft beer bars in london..huge selection!- food doesn't appear to be strong point.Came here around 8pm after other dinner plans had fallen though at last minute.   This is a large establishment with an american style diner section behind the main bar.Our waitress came to take drinks orders, however, she couldn't recall what draught beers were available that night so i had to walk around to the bar to find out. (apparently rotate their taps every few days).  In fairness, however, the service was very good and staff made you feel welcome.The menu was american diner style so I got the monster dog and the wife got the Korea town chicken.  The hot dog was huge and came with either hand-cut chips or fries, however, it was a quite bland and the chips under cooked.  The wife's chicken on the other hand, although looking a quite unappetising, was very juicy and tasty.  Mixed results all around, however in fairness, the waitress did mention earlier they are know for their burgers and fish and chips.i would go back to this bar, but not for dinner.  The beer list is fantastic, and along with the dean swift bar around the corner...this corner of london is a hot spot for the amber nectar.

photos.caption: Photo of The Draft House - London, United Kingdom. Monster dog and korea town wings

JLTAHWv1DVKh0WyGcskkpg.text: We stumbled across this place when we wanted to go somewhere for a quick drink and snack, and ended up having dinner. The bar is quite big and spacious that's perfect for having huge groups of friends, but there are little tables if you're with one other person, which is where we sat. It's great when the sun's out because the sunlight pours through the big windows and right where you sit. We ordered drinks and three appetisers: fried wings, nachos and cajun fries. They came in huge portions so if you're looking for just a light meal, don't order too much! The fried wings were definitely my favourite... crispy on the outside and so juicy on the inside. The whole thing was covered in buttery bread crumbs, which I've never had before. Absolutely addicting. The nachos were great as well, just enough stuff on top so there was no chips left behind. The fries were covered with cajun powder-stuff along with cajun mayo... the whole combination was phenomenal. Just the three choices left us completely full and satisfied. Felt really guilty because it was so unhealthy but hey, that's what weekend gluttony is for. So if you're down for a fattening experience with a bunch of friends, this is a great place to indulge :)

photos.caption: Photo of The Draft House - London, United Kingdom. nachos
Photo of The Draft House - London, United Kingdom. THE BEST FRIED CHICKEN
Photo of The Draft House - London, United Kingdom

TBvwZb3n6a8NkUNlToSDIA.text: This is a pretty good solid place where to have a beer and something to eat while being in the block. I'd not get on a bus to dine here, but I'd love to get back here whenever I'll be in london bridge during the evening.Their selection of beers is huge, and I couldn't find something I'd not like to try (plus they open a barrel and they serve it at 2.75£ a pint as long as there is beer in it, so show up early and help them what they can't store!) and they serve some classical pub food, burgers, hot dogs and so on. We had fish and chips, which was definitely well done (not as well as Poppies, but definitely something I'd like to eat again) but I'd look over burgers next time, they seemed incredibly tasty (and massive!), probably on the bargain monday!Come here, drink beer, enjoy the place!

8bCunSrM2TzwwDnUhP2z8w.text: My go-to pub/restaurant.  Sadly, I've seen it go downhill like a greased barrel in a mudslide.  I don't know how they choose staff, but while some are nice, the majority seem weirdly reluctant to be there.  There's one dude who alternates between picking his nose behind the bar, ignoring customers who have walked up to place and order, and then scornfully complying.  It's like being at Fawlty Towers minus the boot-licking.Most recently, took our friends in town there, about 10 of us.  The staff seemed mildly annoyed we were there at all.  Despite it being a slow night, we had to get up and walk over to ask for food or drinks each time, and nearly every time they had forgotten something. So there was a lot of waiting on ourselves.The kicker was  EVERYBODY who ate a burger getting violent food poisoning.  We emailed them to let them know since 6 of us were so sick, but received no response.Yah. Methinks not.

qObHlB0WuC10a4FqcQKkBg.text: Had been here a few times before but never eaten and now a while ago stumbled in here when trying to find a spot to watch the football on TV and have a bite to eat. First of all the place has a pretty nice design and feel to it. Despite being some sort of chain it does have a somewhat genuine feel to it.Staff were friendly and quickly had us seated at a table. The places is fairly good for watching some sports on TV as well although the TVs are not optimally placed to be able to watch from all the seats.Prices here decent, Mondays are a bargain with any burger and pint for £9.75 but otherwise the burgers and rest of the dishes as well are competitively priced. The beers are neither expensive nor cheap and the selection is really good, at least in theory - the two first items I tried to order were sold out so not sure it is a coincidence but they managed to find a decent substitute.The burger was pretty decent, not really cooked as requested (had asked for medium rare but this was a bit more than medium) but still tasty. The french fries are actually great, not normally a huge fan but these were great. Otherwise the service tended to get slower and slower the more people showed up, understandable but they could have been one more person working. Now had to wait 10 minutes for a drink, 5 minutes for cutlery, 10 minutes to pay so was a bit annoying but still like the place with so many beers on tap, good food at decent prices and friendly atmosphere.

4bV6GnmrPlRUDNIs6xE3rg.text: Mediocre food with pretty abysmal service really doesn't do it for me and this place was no exception. We felt forgotten about, had to ask several times for menus, water, to place an order etc. staff seemed like they couldn't care less! Food was only ok, chips quite salty and I've had better burgers at one of the many pop up places around town. Bathrooms also in quite a state- always a downer!! Won't be in a hurry back here, that's for sure.

29fDgxLqc32R1p8VTSl7Iw.text: Came to London for our honeymoon and visited The Draft House many times on our 8 day trip. Wonderful food, awesome bartenders and of course... Amazing beer.

whe3Oer4yIG7-XUhv8A1sg.text: Well placed for the passing tourist trade, just south as it is of Tower Bridge, the Draft House remains refreshingly local and (from what I've seen) is never overwhelmingly busy. This is probably due, actually, to its location. It's not an obvious choice as a drinking establishment for tourists, since there aren't any hotels in the immediate vicinity. And it doesn't draw a huge after-work crowd, since Shad Thames isn't particularly known for its office buildings and it isn't immediately near any underground stations. Therefore, yes, it's mostly a hangout for those who live in Shad Thames. And not just Shad Thamers, but those Shad Thamers who aren't keen on the posh riverside eating/drinking establishments.So what I'm saying is, the vibe - it's cool.More importantly, the beer - it's good. 20-something beers on tap, 4 ales, 2 ciders and even more bottled options. If you can't find something here that you like to drink, you may as well give up on life now. Because I imagine your life is a dark hole of straight-laced misery and despair.And, finally, the food. While a bit on the pedestrian side, it certainly didn't disappoint. And the very American-style service you'll receive (table-service, actually getting you stuff you ask for, checking back on you, explaining drink and food menus, etc) makes up for anything the food may be lacking, certainly.I'm well impressed by the Draft House. The fact that I live 3 minutes' walk away, well, that probably helps too. But even if I didn't, I'd travel for the beer selection.Oh, and it has a brunch menu at the weekend. Bonus points.

8ziX1WTA6Ni_6QIEUlzd_Q.text: Their mushroom burger was the meatiest veggie burger I've ever tasted. Much recommended! They also do a pint of house cask for £2.75 which is pretty much unheard of in London. I really enjoyed it basically - I was starving and really thirsty at that point so it probably helped.

ejI-f_IvUS_VFSp1QI2fVQ.text: This pub was exactly what we were looking for: a late midday snack and some good beers between our walking and the cinema. The Draft House did not disappoint.There beer selecting is amazing and already the best reason to visit. Several British, German and Belgian beers on draft and on bottle. I had a pint of Brugze Zot blonde and a pint of the Helle Weisse. We took some "healthy" finger-foot to go with it and ended up with a portion of fries,tacos and deep-fried chicken wings. Normally tacos in a pub are quite poor of quality as if they've been microwaved, but these were really good! The tomato salsa came with beans on top and some sauces on the side. But definitely the best item we ordered were the chicken-wings! Fried to perfection with some bbq-sauce on the side, these were crunchy on the outside and tender white chicken meat on the inside; well done! We even weren't that hungry but devoured everything. The service was extremely friendly and helpful. I definitely go back, since I didn't even had the chance to try one of their burgers or special hot-dogs!

MWIiUFZWPHQIsFPlORTbfQ.text: Came here on a Saturday night..visiting from Florida.  Draft selection was good. Ambiance was nice and food was good. I had a veggie burger..very delicious with great texture and my husband had burger. We also tried pickle chips which were delicious..however you can't go wrong with something fried. We also had scotch eggs. Those were not great overall according to my husband. I would give this place a 4 out of 5.

edkZ74aLG5CI9BjkI0nQ_w.text: Went here for lunch with some mates. Really good burgers. I had the Smoke Burger which has bacon, chipotle, and the usual tomato and lettuce. Friend had the Poke, which had two massive onion rings and some spicy chillies.  Both were really good and the chips were great too!

photos.caption: Photo of The Draft House - London, United Kingdom. Smoke burger. Legit.

QmQ162gtLNCiZXbs7ZGalg.text: Have been a few times since my first review and have never been thrilled but today was time to update my review. I went for dinner with friends in town. From the time we walked in the staff treated us as an inconvenience with sighs and irritated looks. Pushy asking for order and then forgetting that we asked for water. Was a bit shocked at the end that it had 12.5% service charge tacked on!! Set up to rip off tourists. No thanks won't be back.

UdAXSLp8Hvcbp1N1TtzK-A.text: Really nice, loved the selection of food and beverages. All of our group left happy.

w-jvdE3vrCarR5hy8laelQ.text: Good burgers and ale. I prefer my fries/chips more on the thin and crispy side but the cajun chips hit the spot. Will come back.

6aXZBDkd2pKMhXZDmKq_Pw.text: Note: Thought I'd try something new and write a review as it happened. Normally this would never be the case, but since I've been to Draft House Tower Bridge several times before, I feel that I can represent this place properly.To start off, Mondays are excellent days for a bit of dinner and a pint at the Draft House. Why? Because they have an excellent burger Monday deal. You get any burger, chips, and a pint of house lager or Aspall cider for just under £9.75. How cool is that?The waitstaff are very friendly with one girl running the tables while looking as if she's just stepped out of a J Crew catalogue. I'm not quite sure how that matches with the general theme, but she makes it work. Now the big question, will they let me play a Drink Deck card in conjunction with the burger Monday offer?Yep, they will! Although you will need to order at least one more item as two burger Monday deals will leave you just shy by 50p. However, with the incredible range of beers and ales available on tap, in a cask, and bottled, the only problem you will have is making a choice (ask you server to recommend based on your tastes, they are usually quite knowledgeable).Food-wise, the burgers are interesting but with massive patties (we're talking almost 2 inches/7cm thick here) which leaves them a bit dry for the most part. I'd highly recommend ordering it medium rare rather than the standard medium to preserve some of the juices. The Yolk (burger with a fried egg on top) seems to be the most popular although I found the glazed hollandaise sauce to be far to rich for even my decandent tastes. The "Smoke" could do with a bit more smokiness (add bbq sauce please!). The chips and fries are both excellent with crisp skins and fluffy soft cores and the bun is toasted which adds a nice bit of crunch.Beers are of course excellent. The Draft House lager is slightly sweet and very refreshing. I also tried a Coopers Stout which was rich, slightly bitter, and had strong notes of dark chocolate. Excellent stout all around and it made me wish I had space for that chocolate brownie and ice cream I saw on the menu. Overall, a great place for a drink (be careful though, some of those beers range up to 10.0% abv), and a decent place for a bite. It's hard to beat the value especially when you play your Drink Deck Card!

1CVwm6MQiKU8u6YkT4Axpg.text: We have visited a few times just for drinks and they have a great selection of craft beers by bottle or on tap, at fairly reasonable prices considering the location.Tonight we stopped in for a bite to eat, trying the rare breed cheeseburger and what a treat! The burger tasted fantastic and the fries were excellent too! Combine that with efficient and friendly service and prices not too dissimilar to Byron, this place is well worth a go. We will definitely be back!

WInuVbs_edOHWJWTuWCwKg.text: Great craft beers at reasonable prices.  The interior is lovely and the food looked amazing.  I've never been here and not managed to find a seat which is another huge benefit.My only reason for not giving a fourth star is that it seems somewhat understaffed - even when the place is half full you have to wait.

lSZbXYxV3x4OMH_H-Ae1gA.text: The Draft House at Tower Bridge offers a great range of beer and plenty of seating but so-so food and poor acoustics.Chief amongst the attractions here is the beer. Like its sister Draft Houses in Battersea, Clapham and Dulwich, the Draft House here offers somewhere between 50-100 beers. Beer lovers won't find truly exotic stuff, but it's still an impressive range comfortably better than the vast majority of London's pubs.The food, centered around burgers and steaks, is less convincing. I've had disappointing results when ordering burgers (they offer three: the 'Yoke', 'Toke' and 'Smoke') at other Draft houses cooked at medium, so here I opted to have a 'Yoke' well-done and the result was disappointing once more. So it's back to the drawing board.The acoustics at the large table we were at were also poor, making it difficult to hear each other sometimes. Service was a bit so-so too: it took me 5-10 minutes to get a drink when I arrived.Still, the combination of an unusually good range of beer AND (take note, Euston Tap) plenty of seating makes this a solid bet despite its failings. Definitely worth popping in for a decent beer if in the area.

fle5rNHlrzikxxW0ShzoVQ.text: We came here on a Wednesday after a full day of sightseeing. It happened to be two for one wings. We had wings, burgers, sweet potato fries and fried pickles. Everything was very good, and the food came out promptly. Also, the staff was friendly and helpful. I would definitely come here again for fast, casual food.

VfUcjMC7ySFVasBqlJ9jAg.text: Good beer selection but at 10:55 on a Friday night they sold my friend and I a beer without calling last call and then 5m later turned the nights up to max and turned off the music. Completely ruined the mood and atmosphere. Why not say anything when we got beers??

rs6le2OtcPDoW8KdamVp3A.text: Good beer selection, solid pub grub. It was a bit confusing regarding seating, as apparently only half the place has table service. You have to ask to get instructions on where to order if you're in the "non table service" side. Not exactly proactive with help, and cleanliness doesn't seem to be a high priority here, but then, it's a pub, even though it's a chain pub. Location was convenient for the Tower Bridge.

photos.caption: Photo of The Draft House - London, United Kingdom. Beef pie
Photo of The Draft House - London, United Kingdom. Crispy whitebait

jmRgYKk6qc7jsGbjvbxjNA.text: Went here after touring the Tower Bridge and was pleasantly surprised to find such a chill and good spot. The staff was friendly and helpful. Split the fish and chips and it was more than enough food -- and we are big eaters. Paired with a local IPA and a sticky toffee pudding with vanilla ice cream for dessert, it was a delightful meal that gave us sustenance to trek on with sightseeing. Pro-tip: Mondays they have half-price burgers! One of the people in my party took up the offer and was not disappointed.

photos.caption: Photo of The Draft House - London, United Kingdom. Fish and chips -- this is HALF an order and plenty of food! YUM!!!

Bn23uIi-kt8rNA4GS3PInw.text: Located near the tower bridge and the Tower of London. Pub life where you order at the bar and food will be delivered to your table.I was surprised that one drink is included with your burger! I paid around 8 pounds for a veggie burger and local hazy hog cider. You can't beat this! I loved that it was a hang out for the locals as well. Great place to play some cards and do some people watching.

Ve1Lk2KDle0g9h7BwRJpUA.text: Chill spot right down from the Tower Bridge. The £5 paddle of the day is a flight of 3, 1/3 pints of beer and is a great way to sample a few different beers! You can also create your own paddle with 1/3 pint pours off their draft list.

IbnRGdOGNM9iSEgNVuXSfA.text: Extremely bad service, personal is only looking stupid and don't do there job. Music way to loud, toilets dirty. Sorry but when I get over half an hour no service in a 50% empty local, you loose customers.

dKgOa2GlSB_xFkF1iGnImA.text: Excellent range of beers and American style food. Right on Tower Bridge Road so  visit the tourist locations then relax at the Draft House. Half price burgers every Monday. Regular quiz nights. Great atmosphere.

photos.caption: Photo of The Draft House - London, United Kingdom. Draft House menu

-1doPwIuuW2cuQ00U6ynQA.text: My boyfriend and I came here for lunch on a rainy London day. We were seated right away and our server was very friendly. I ordered Fish n Chips and a beer and my boyfriend ordered some sort of sandwich. I'm not sure if it was because I was so hungry or if the food was just that good, but I ate every bite of my Fish n Chips. My beer was pretty good too. My boyfriend didn't eat all of his food, so I'm not sure that he was too impressed. I found the restaurant to be clean and the bathroom was located downstairs (odd). I'd recommend coming here since it is close to The Tower Bridge and you can easily get to the restaurant before or after your tour of the bridge. Cheers.

cb3aHK6FU_z4fRWVqzRCJQ.text: It's a walking distance to Tower Bridge. Literally at the end of it's not difficult to find. We met with some of our friends while on vacation at this place. We ordered their burgers. I'm not sure if it's normal in other countries to ask how your burgers are done but they didn't. Surprisingly, it came out perfectly cooked (medium to medium well), which is the way I like it. If you like your burger cooked differently, you probably would have to specifically tell them.They have a large variety of beers you could pick from which was nice. They also carry beers that are known around the world (although I recommend getting local beer). I'm pretty sure they brew their own beers, too. It wasn't packed when we got there but there are two areas where you could sit. There's a dining area behind the bar so if you want to just eat without being tempted by beers around you, they have an area for that.Overall, the place is very casual and it's a nice pub to meet at for a casual drink after work.

photos.caption: Photo of The Draft House - London, United Kingdom. so many beer choices!
Photo of The Draft House - London, United Kingdom. Burger with poutine fries!

6iSTjj43RA8ebaFVSYXJ0g.text: This review is for the Bump Caves which is in the basement of the Draft House.  I was with three others and we were looking for a place to have a few drinks after dinner.  Bump Caves was a good option as it wasn't blaring with music or heaving with people so it was a great place to catch up with friends.The place has a good vibe to it and feels quite roomy even though it's underground.  They have their own home made gin and other drink concoctions.  I got one of their signature gin and tonics.  Given it's price point and the fact that Bump Caves distill their own gin, I had quite high expectations.  Unfortunately, the drink just didn't look good - check out photos.  It was just Gin and Tonic - nothing special.The staff were friendly and it's a nice and central spot but the cocktails weren't anything to write home about.  FYI as Bump Caves is in the basement there wasn't any signal (at least on my network, 3) and I couldn't connect to their wifi for some reason...so watch out if you need signal!

photos.caption: Photo of The Draft House - London, United Kingdom. The Uneventful Gin and Tonic.
Photo of The Draft House - London, United Kingdom

_VnbkyDYi2ogW_xFgkpZPA.text: So I actually stumble upon this place while walking across the tower bridge. It is the 3rd-4th restaurant you see once you cross the tower bridge and as I found out, I would not be disappointed. They have about 20-25 beers on tap and after have 3 full glasses and about 8 taste, I can say that there all top of the line.For food I had a couple of things. First I had a starter and my choice of a boat load of wings (the container is shaped that of a boat.). The wings were basically baked and the sauce was like a frank hot sauce glaze. They gave you about 14-16 and the wings were great, the best wings I had in the city of London. For my meal I went with a bratwurst with sauerkraut( pretty good, however mustard in London is either the Dijon or the hot mustard and i learned the hard way) and a boatload of Cajun fries, which to were really good. Overall I am really glad I ran into this place and yes I would/will come back.

VuLsVu0KzDrppqptCBj-6Q.text: I'm writing this review about Bump Caves, their underground bar. My boyfriend and I visited as we had a great value voucher to try out the cocktails. It's a really great spot - music is good and isn't too loud. The decor is cool and the staff were friendly and knowledgeable. The cocktail menu is very unique and was quite intriguing, such as the Electric Kool Aid Acid Test where you pour in the citric acid and lick a battery to change the drink's flavour, or the savoury ingredients (blue cheese?!) included in some other drinks. They all tasted great and we had a great evening.Only 2 things I could possibly say as negative is that 1) our night would have been way more expensive without the voucher (but that's London for you so I suppose that doesn't count) and 2) it was just not that busy at all, leaving the place feeling a bit lack luster. We thought it was such a shame as this place definitely deserves to be popular! It's still a relatively new place so I hope it picks up soon.

photos.caption: Photo of The Draft House - London, United Kingdom. Their controversial cocktail: Electric Kool Aid Acid Test

uGumEtdwuMGACSyyoQwUTw.text: Lovely place for a pint of your favorite brew and an even better lunch.  I has the salmon on bagel and my friends had the goat cheese toasty...Both were highly recommended.

photos.caption: Photo of The Draft House - London, United Kingdom. Can't miss it...right down the street from Tower Bridge

CKsK0ElwbJTk0EVjIdUI6w.text: We needed a small bite after The Tower of London and thankfully The Draft House was on the other side of the bridge. Positives: a GIANT plate of nachos that 3 of us shared. Could have used some more cheese but unlike other places, the nachos were wonderfully warm. A fabulous cider and black (throwback I know, but my first in 15 years), friendly servers, and excellent prices.Negatives: No one to greet you at the door. We found a table ourselves and had to flag someone down who said, "Oh, I didn't see you come in.". Had to get up and find someone to get the check.

XCWbmnUvI65adCuQbD3pwg.text: Not impressed with the food (we had nachos and pulled pork sandwich) but ultra impressed with their bar selection. the fact that I was able to get some mongozo coconut beer made me happy. It's a good location as it's right next to the tower bridge, but I wouldn't eat here. Take a break from sightseeing? Yes.Free wifi is a plus.

ynkP7UtgGiVjNPLKOntoCw.text: I'd say their stronger on their beer selection than their burger selection (their 'Give me this our daily cask' promotion is clever where an ale is discounted until it's gone) as they have several pages of all styles of beer.They also do a really good job of having ongoing promotions for sporting events (Rugby World and Football World Cup) and mini competitions on social media between their various locations to make each visit unique and interesting.The 'Smoke' burger is quite tasty with streaky bacon and the veggie burger is also an unexpected surprise for a restaurant touting their meat credentials so hard.  Chips are only okay based on my assessment as they seemed a bit lacking in the 'crispiness' department.

_RAOjEYGuDXTLiMMMnPMQA.text: You're smart, and I like you.  Now, you may or not be aware that I like beer.  If you have read any of my other reviews, you may get an inkling.   But since you're smart, I don't want you to think my 3-star review of Draft House is negative in anyway.  It's not.This place had a better beer selection that most of the places I visited in London. The bartenders were very nice.  The location was nice.  But there was just something missing, and I can't put my finger on it.   It seemed kind of sterile to me.   It's roomy, clean and friendly so I definitely recommend giving it a go, but it's just not the type of place I could see myself drinking regularly and comfortably.There's absolutely nothing wrong with it, it's just not my scene.  But you're smart so you get that.  And that's one of the reasons why I like you.  Plus that one other thing you do, but let's not talk about that here.

photos.caption: Photo of The Draft House - London, United Kingdom. men's room
Photo of The Draft House - London, United Kingdom. more taps
Photo of The Draft House - London, United Kingdom. taps

0AVlpXd2-Gvq9zlXI8HLnA.text: Came here to have a beer and burger. I was not disappointing on either front. We got a good spot next to the window so we could enjoy the mixed crowd full of some locals and some tourists. People seemed relaxed and happy here and it was contagious. My date and I split a burger with fries and a plate of nachos. The burger was great and the nachos were pretty good. If I was looking for a burger and pint, I could see myself heading over to this draft house location.

photos.caption: Photo of The Draft House - London, United Kingdom. Dining room.

4r5LdTDN6EbRPf-YMB7fNA.text: Ok, so the whole London restaurant scene have convinced us that paying £15 for a burger and chips is the norm.  I have finally made my peace with this fact and I can now start enjoying myself.As you would expect from the Draft House the beer menu has plenty of choices and ideal if you want to try something a little different. I had a pulled pork sandwich and my fellow diners both had burgers. We all agreed the food was above par, chips were cooked well and the pulled pork/burgers were extremely good. The bar was busy and the atmosphere was bustling. Our waiter was a little quirky but pleasant and efficient enough.I would fully recommend if you want a casual meal or even just a drink with friends. This is of course, only if you have become numb to what a normal London "gourmet" burger costs.
